p: α-Fe 2O 3 was effectively recycled from mill scale waste material and the complex permittivity improved significantly by reducing the particle size through high-energy ball milling for 12 h. The imaginary part of complex permittivity ( ε″), essential for microwave absorption properties, increased from 0.14 to 0.40 at 1 GHz when the particle size was reduced from 1.73 to 16.2 nm. The 16.2 nm recycled α-Fe 2O 3 nanoparticles were used as filler in PCL matrix reinforced with 100 μm OPEFB fiber to fabricate recycled α-Fe 2O 3/OPEFB/PCL nanocomposites which showed increased complex permittivity values and good absorption properties with increased nanofiller content. A minimum reflection loss of −24.2 dB was obtained for the 20 wt.% nanocomposite at 2.4 GHz. The recycled α-Fe 2O 3/OPEFB/PCL nanocomposites are cheap, easy to fabricate and are effective for microwave absorption applications in the 1–4 GHz range.
